channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Update Structure Fire - FATALITY; INC#1299; 06:46PM; 963 N Serrano Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46yLBRv; East Hollywood; The patient transported with serious burn injuries sadly was pronounced at the hospital, making this a fatality fire. The victim is a male estimated to be in his 60s. LAFD Arson is investigating and there is no additional information to release at this time.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; AR1 BC5 E227 E235 E52 E6 E61 E82 EM11 RA27 RA52 RA82 RA827 SO1 T27 T35; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1299; 05:56PM; 963 N Serrano Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46yLBRv; East Hollywood; KNOCKDOWN: 36 firefighters extinguished the contents fire in 19 minutes. One patient with serious burn injuries being transported by LAFD paramedics (age/gender unknown at this time). LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation per protocol for serious injury. No further details.; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E227 E235 E52 E6 E61 E82 EM11 RA27 RA52 RA82 SO1 T27 T35; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1299; 05:37PM; 963 N Serrano Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/46yLBRv; East Hollywood; Two story duplex with moderate smoke showing from one unit on the 2nd floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 52; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC5 E227 E235 E52 E6 E82 RA52 RA82 SO1 T27 T35; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0244; 06:52AM; 1418 N New Hampshire Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/48YNDfr; East Hollywood; KNOCKDOWN: This incident is now classified as a Major Emergency structure fire. Firefighters faced a heavily boarded up entry into and up to the involved area which caused a delay in reaching the seat of the fire. Once crews reached the two involved units in the corner of the building, they were able to conduct an effective fire attack and extinguished the fire with one hour on the incident clock. There are no injuries reported. LAFD PIO Captain Adam VanGerpen is enroute for media availability. LAFD Arson is responding for the investigation per protocol for an incident of this size. No further details.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E12 E20 E202 E203 E211 E220 E227 E235 E250 E27 E3 E35 E56 E6 E61 E76 E82 EA1 EM1 EM55 HR3 RA27 RA35 RA803 RA827 RA835 SO1 SQ21 T11 T2 T20 T27 T3 T35 T50 UR27 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0244; 05:52AM; 1418 N New Hampshire Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/48YNDfr; East Hollywood; Two story vacant hotel property with fire on the 2nd floor. Roof ventilation has opened holes and has heavy fire through the holes. There are no other structures exposed. There are no injuries reported. This incident is at the Greater Alarm status.; FS 35; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 13; BC1 BC11 BC5 CM20 CM22 CM52 E20 E211 E220 E227 E235 E250 E27 E3 E35 E56 E6 E76 E82 EM1 HR3 RA27 RA35 RA803 RA827 RA835 SO1 SQ21 T11 T20 T27 T35 T50 UR27 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Hiker Rescue - Hoist Op; INC#1276; 06:53PM; Griffith Park; MAP: https://bit.ly/45Ehcjn; Hollywood Hills; LAFD Air Ops located and will conduct a hoist operation for transport of a 55yo female patient with facial trauma sustained in a 10' fall. The 9-1-1 call was received at 6:14PM. No further details.; FS 82; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; AO1 BC5 E227 E27 E82 E90 H4 H7 HA4 HA7 RA82 RA827 RH114 T27 UR27; CH7; 12; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0935; 03:23PM; 442 W Rosecrans Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MbunRY; Harbor Gateway; UPDATE: This incident is now determined to be within the jurisdiction of the Los Angeles County Fire Department and LAFD is handing over the incident to their command. Any questions regarding this incident are referred to LACoFD. ; FS 79; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC11 BC13 BC4 BC6 CM20 CM22 E233 E238 E264 E266 E285 E33 E46 E64 E65 E79 E85 E95 EA1 EM13 FR64 HE1 HR3 PI3 RA264 RA64 RA79 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T33 T38 T64 T66 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0935; 03:16PM; 442 W Rosecrans Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MbunRY; Harbor Gateway; KNOCKDOWN: Over 80 LAFD firefighters, with assistance from LACoFD and Compton Fire Dept, extinguished the fire in 41 minutes with no injuries reported. LAFD remained in command of the incident and it will be an extensive overhaul operation with LAFD heavy equipment responding to assist. LAFD resources will remain in the area into the evening and drivers are advised to seek alternate routes. Cause is not yet determined. No further details.; FS 79; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC11 BC13 BC4 BC6 CM20 CM22 E233 E238 E264 E266 E285 E33 E46 E64 E65 E79 E85 E95 EA1 EM13 FR64 HR3 PI3 RA264 RA64 RA79 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T33 T38 T64 T66 T85 UR85 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Update Structure Fire; INC#0935; 03:06PM; 442 W Rosecrans Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MbunRY; Harbor Gateway; The structure has a complete roof collapse and that roof is the primary fuel burning as the building appears to be empty. The ember cast from the fire appears to have ignited a 50' trailer several buildings down from the fire. The trailer was fully involved and exposing another large commercial building. Firefighters extinguished the fire and investigated to confirm there was no extension into the structure. The jurisdiction of this fire (whether within County or City boundaries) is being determined and LAFD remains as Incident Command at this time. There are LACoFD and Compton Fire Dept resources on scene as well. No injuries reported. This incident is at the Greater Alarm status. LAFD PIO Captain Cody Weireter is enroute for media availability. ; FS 79; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC11 BC13 BC4 BC6 CM20 CM22 E233 E238 E264 E266 E285 E33 E46 E64 E65 E79 E85 E95 EA1 EM13 FR64 HR3 RA264 RA64 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T33 T38 T64 T66 T85 UR85 UR88; CH9; 12 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0935; 02:29PM; 442 W Rosecrans Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3MbunRY; Harbor Gateway; One story, commercial building (vacant) with heavy fire showing. Firefighters are in the defensive mode and initiating heavy streams. Additional resources requested. LACoFD is also on scene.; FS 79; Batt 6; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 BC6 CM20 CM22 E233 E238 E264 E64 E65 E79 RA264 RA64 T33 T38 T64; CH9; 12; Margaret Stewart
